column5: I am really having fun with this camera. It is way easier than getting up at 5am to see what's cooking out in the woods. The 10 point Buck only showed for one picture during the night in the past week but his lady friends are making frequent visits, day and night.  I also had a new visitor, an Opossum. The Raccoons must not get along with them since they high tailed it up into the trees.    I had a Doe show up during daylight for the first time last Monday Morning.    But by Friday two does came by for a snack at 8:50am   At 2:20pm   and at 6pm.    I spent Sunday morning in the blind from sun up till 9:30am and as usual only seen squirrels. I decided to move my camera out to the little field just past the deer in the pictures.  The camera is now on the tree that has the black feeder block(that the Raccoons ate) on it. I dumped more apples after flattening down the tall Golden Rod. I checked the camera today and was happy to see that three Does came by this morning around 8:30am.     I am hoping their presence will have that 10 point show during the day while rutting. I just have to be there when it happens.  Although I am enjoying getting hundreds of pictures of Raccoons  ,  I am not enjoying trying to keep up with them taking all the apples. I put out a fresh batch on Sat afternoon. Here is the pile at 7:30pm   And now no apples at 2:30am.   Guess who showed up at 5:30am to find the snacks all gone.   If the wind is right I will be out before the weekend. I will try to get a video of the does.
Nice pics. What type of Bushnell cam did you get? I'm thinking of getting one but prefer the Bushnell brand. If you have a pic of it you can post, please do.
With the rut starting soon and all those does around there I wouldnt change a thing!!

Here is the link to Bushnell's web page on the model I have.    http://www.bushnell.com/products/trail-cameras/trail-sentry/ Day photos have been good but the night ones have a lot of lines and white outs.
That would be the mateing scenes.LOL  Looks like you should be good for one Doug.

The Does are really camping out in the area now. It is hard to tell but in the new camera location there is a large apple tree in the top right hand corner behind the deer. It is loaded with hundreds of apples still so the deer are also passing frequently to pick up those apples as they fall. I checked the camera again today and I have another 12 pics or so of the Does. They came by at five different times starting at 6:20pm yesterday to 9am this morning.
Nice Skud Some good deer action around your stand..... and that big boy showing up all of sudden is bonus Hope for you that he stays around cause that's a real nice one!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
That means a whole day sit.  Thats what I plan on doing.Dusk til dawn. Better strap myself to the tree,just incase a nap becomes me.LOL  Good luck bud.

Great photos!  I've finally got a few on mine, i'll post another thread as to not hijack this one:)  I had my trail cam stolen this past summer, I had to move into the hardwoods....I finally broke down and bought one last friday and was pleasantly surprised to see some doe's on it....not one buck yet....
I finally have a second Buck posing for the camera. A younger 9 point. Those Bucks are still staying nocturnal.
